campaignEntries.rawText:
## Melee
| d100 Roll | Mishap Due to a Critical Failure on a Melee Attack |
|---------- |----------------------------------------------------- |
| 1-2        | Your attack misses and instead you strike a nearby object, damaging your weapon. You must make a d20 roll to determine the extent of damage. |
| 3-4        | Due to your terrible miscalculation, you drop your weapon. It lands 1d6 feet away from you. |
| 5-6        | You lose your balance, becoming prone. For your next turn, you will need to spend half your movement to stand back up. |
| 7-8        | You accidentally hit yourself when swinging your weapon too hard. Roll weapon damage against yourself. |
| 9-10      | Your grip on your weapon loosens and you throw it away by mistake. The weapon lands 2d6 feet away in a random direction. |
| 11-12    | Instead of your enemy, you strike an ally nearby. Roll damage for your ally. |
| 13-14    | Your attack rebounds off an object, hitting you instead. The Dungeon Master rolls your weapon's damage against you. |
| 15-16    | You misstep and fall, losing half your movement on your next turn. |
| 17-18    | You stumble into a hostile creature, providing it an opportunity to make an attack of opportunity. |
| 19-20    | You significantly expose your defense, every attack roll against you has advantage for the next round. |
| 21-22    | You miss your target so widely, you lose sight of another opponent for one round. |
| 23-24    | You spin uncontrollably after your attack and end up facing the wrong direction. |
| 25-26    | Your weapon becomes lodged in a nearby object. You must spend your next action to free it. |
| 27-28    | Your attack opens a gap in your defense, leaving you with -2 AC until your next turn. |
| 29-30    | You stumble, moving 1d6 feetaway from your original position. |
| 31-32    | You throw your weapon accidentally during your attack, causing your ally to be disarmed. |
| 33-34    | You fail to control your weapon's swing and it leaves your hand, landing 1d6 feet away from you in a random direction. |
| 35-36    | Due to a careless mistake, you leave yourself open. Your opponent has advantage on their next attack roll against you. |
| 37-38    | You fall prone, providing a chance for your enemies to take an attack of opportunity. |
| 39-40    | You accidentally hit your leg with your weapon. Take damage equal to half your weapon's damage. |
| 41-50   | Your attack inadvertently damages your weapon (-1 to attack and damage rolls until repaired). |
| 51-60   | You lose your footing and fall, becoming prone. |
| 61-70   | You accidentally knock your weapon against a hard surface, causing a noticeable dent. |
| 71-80   | You overexert yourself and take 1 level of exhaustion. |
| 81-90   | You misjudge your attack, leaving an opening. The next attack roll against you has advantage. |
| 91-100 | You slip and trigger a trap within 5 feet of you, if there is any. |

## Ranged
| d100 | Critical Failure Result |
|------|----------------------------|
| 1    | Your bowstring snaps, rendering the weapon unusable until it is repaired. |
| 2    | Your thrown weapon slips, landing at your feet instead of at your target. |
| 3    | Your missile veers wildly, hitting an unintended target. Reroll attack against ally in range, take lowest roll. |
| 4    | A strong gust of wind deflects your projectile, causing it to miss completely. |
| 5    | Your attack ricochets and hits a nearby object, potentially causing a distraction or other unexpected result. |
| 6    | Your grip slips, jarring your aim. Your target gains a significant advantage on their next attack or action. |
| 7    | Your ammunition is faulty, exploding upon being fired or thrown. Take 1d6 damage. |
| 8    | You pull too hard on your slingshot, causing it to snap and hit you in the face. Stunned for 1 round. |
| 9    | You miscalculate the arc of your thrown weapon, hitting a non-combatant or a harmless object. |
| 10   | Your crossbow misfires, launching the bolt directly upwards. Spend next round avoiding incoming bolt. |
| 11-20 | Your attack simply misses your target. |
| 21-30 | Your awkward attack leaves you unbalanced, decreasing your AC by 2 until your next turn. |
| 31-40 | The force of your release leaves you with a minor injury. Take 1 point of damage.  |
| 41-50 | Your shot is so off mark, it seems to hit nothing at all. |
| 51-60 | You trip as you throw, ending prone and causing the attack to miss. |
| 61-70 | Your concentration falters, causing you to misread the wind. Your next ranged attack is at disadvantage. |
| 71-80 | Your poor aim results in your thrown weapon being lost. |
| 81-90 | An unfortunate twist in your release causes the weapon to hit you instead. Take your own attack damage. |
| 91-99 | Your arrow/bolt/stone goes off course, potentially triggering a trap or causing a rockslide. |
| 100   | The universe seems against you. Not only does your attack miss, but your weapon breaks, rendering it unusable until repaired. |

## Arcane
| Roll (d100) | Mishap |
|-------------|-------------------------------------------------------------------|
| 1           | Your magic backfires, you take the maximum possible damage.       |
| 2           | Your arcane energies wildly swing releasing a loud bang causing temporary deafness in a 10ft radius.|
| 3           | Your hands are badly singed, making it hard to cast spells requiring somatic components until you receive healing.|
| 4           | The magic spirals out of control creating a sinkhole beneath you.|
| 5           | The spell fails but the magical energy is not wasted and instead targets a random ally.|
| 6           | In focusing your magic, you didn't notice an immediate environmental hazard, causing you to trip and fall.|
| 7           | Your magic rebounds, causing you to be levitated uncontrollably for the next minute.|
| 8           | The spell's energy transfers into an inanimate object nearby causing it to animate and turn hostile.|
| 9           | Your arcane symbol or focus becomes extremely hot, inflicting burns and dropping it might cause a fire.|
| 10          | An arcane disruption causes you to lose the understanding of your next highest spell slot.           |
| 11          | The failed spell has drained you, you gain a level of exhaustion.|
| 12          | Your abilities are brought into question by your allies, suffering disadvantage on charisma checks when dealing with them.|
| 13          | The magical feedback makes you lose your sense of direction for an hour.| 
| 14          | You inadvertently tear a small hole in the plane causing a minor elemental to be summoned and it is not happy about it.|
| 15          | The wasted magic causes vibrant and visible arcane tattoos to appear on your skin. They are permanent.|
| 16-20       |  A mysterious arcane backlash causes you to forget the botched spell until you finish a long rest.|
| 21-25       | Arcane energies escape and illuminate you making it hard to hide as you shed bright light in a 10ft radius.|
| 26-30       | You accidentally teleport some of your belongings to an unknown location.|
| 31-35       | You fall unconscious due to magical exhaustion and wake up after 1d4 hours.|
| 36-40       | Magic feedback causes a minor wild magic surge from the Sorcererâ€™s Wild Magic table.|
| 41-45       | You become magically bound to the place you're standing on, unable to move away for 1d4 hours.|
| 46-50       | A string of bad luck affects you granting advantage to the very next attack against you.|
| 51-55       | The magical mishap shatters your confidence. You have disadvantage on spell attack rolls for an hour.|
| 56-60       | The spell inverts its purpose (healing hurts, fire cools, etc.) as determined by the GM.|
| 61-65       | The failed spell causes an object in your vicinity to become magically enchanted with a useless or troubling property.|
| 66-70       | You can't help but speak in rhyme for the next hour.|
| 71-75       | The earsplitting pop of displaced air deafens you for 1d6 minutes.|
| 76-80       | The lost magic manifests as 3d10 gold pieces that shower around you, potentially causing suspicion.|
| 81-85       | You are unable to control your magic fully, unexpectedly casting a different spell from your list.|
| 86-90       | The miscast spell causes you to perceive everyone as a threat causing you to become frightened.|
| 91-95       | You lose the ability to speak any language but gibberish for 1d4 hours due to the arcane mishap.|
| 96-99       | The miscast cracks your arcane focus (if used) rendering it unusable.|
| 100         | An unexpected surge of power turns the failed spell into a much more powerful version, hitting both allies and enemies in its path.|

## Aarakocra
| Dice Value | Name | Description |
|------------|------|-------------|
| 1          | Kehra | A wanderer who sings the songs of the wind, has silver-grey plumage with sharp eyes |
| 2          | Cawren | A flighty prankster, his plumage is a vibrant red and gold |
| 3          | Izurre | A contemplative aarakocra with azure plumage, often seen carving intricate designs into stones |
| 4          | N'kri | Slightly gold tinted, firm in her dedication to nature and protection |
| 5          | Thraaak | A solitary hawk-like aarakocra of dark brown plumage, speaks rarely |
| 6          | Zikkee | An elder with speckles of gray on her plumage, a great storyteller |
| 7          | Rrai | Young and impulsive with bright green plumage, she is full of energy |
| 8          | S'iki | A calm scholar with snowy-white plumage who respectfully keeps his distance |
| 9          | Kinnn | An agile scout with marbled black and white feathers, always alert |
| 10         | Yarkuu | A fiery leader with spark-like red splashes on her plumage |
| 11         | Tuktek | A grey-feathered aarakocra, always seen with scrolls of wisdom around him |
| 12         | V'rii | A golden plumage with deeply focused eyes, she is a patient hunter |
| 13         | Nen're | A slim aarakocra with iridescent feathers and a mesmerizing voice |
| 14         | Pirruk | A bulky aarakocra of mixed grey and blue plumage, fierce in defense |
| 15         | Quaqqa | An endearing figure with plush white plumage, always ready to share a kindness |
| 16         | Xuurza | A veteran scout with copper. Known for his vast knowledge of terrain and tactics |
| 17         | Eek'ri | Plump and jovial, with purple and teal blended plumage, best cook in the tribe |
| 18         | Ska'ka | A watchful guard with ash-gray feathers, rarely seen without her spear |
| 19         | Zizook | Dark green plumage, master of wind whispers. He can sense changes in the weather before they hit |
| 20         | Riki'ku | Multicolored plumage shimmering in sunlight. Skillful jeweler |
| ...        | ... | ... |
| 100        | K'vii | A revered elder with ancient white plumage. Known for her wisdom and diplomatic skills |

## Aasimar
| Dice Value | Name | Description |
| ---| --- | --- |
| 1 | Abdiel | Stern protector with glowing eyes and a hint of golden wings fading into the mist. |
| 2 | Seraphina | Dauntless lady with silver hair and a steady gaze, wreathed in a soft heavenly glow. |
| 3 | Uriel | Tall, hawk-faced individual with radiant eyes imploring for righteous action. |
| 4 | Zephrine | Elegantly poised lady with a nimbus of golden light, indicative of her celestial lineage. |
| 5 | Nathaniel | Youthful, valiant figure with a subtle aura of power and gentle, golden wings. |
| 6 | Evangeline | Serene woman with long silver hair and intense, silver eyes reflecting exceptional insight. |
| 7 | Michael | Robust, armored man his eyes revealing a starry night sky, fingers tingling with divine energy. |
| 8 | Ariel | Vigilant, stolid figure with a gently pulsating halo and a glowing longsword. |
| 9 | Ramiel | Intensely focused individual, his radiant visage hinting a strong bond with the divine. |
| 10 | Gabriel | Striking personage with metallic skin and eyes glowing with an otherworldly blue light. |
| 11 | Jophiel | Hauntingly graceful figure, draped in flowing robes that reflect cosmic energies. |
| 12 | Cassiel | Stoic personality with an otherworldly aura and faintly radiant eyes. |
| 13 | Selaphiel | Strikingly honest personality with mild wings that shimmer softly in daylight. |
| 14 | Zuriel | Unyielding and indomitable, he emanates a steady radiance from his brightly shining eyes. |
| 15 | Raziel | Intimidating warrior possessing a calm, tranquil gaze and divine, burning aura. |
| 16 | Irad | Ethereal beauty, with soft glowing skin and an aura generating a soothing warmth. |
| 17 | Arariel | A radiant scholar adorned with a halo of gossamer light, carries an air of wisdom. |
| 18 | Azrael | Edgy persona, a halo subtly glowing despite the somber expressions; synonymous with fierce justice. |
| 19 | Metatron | Brawny figure with an aura of authority; eyes shimmering intensely with divine energies. |
| 20 | Haniel | A person of keen intellect, the wisdom of ages reflected in tranquil, glowing eyes. |
| 21 | Bethor | Noble warrior with radiant wings, steel grey eyes hinting at immense power. |
| 22 | Leliel | Ferocious individual emanating a protective aura, subtle light flickering around sword edges. |
| 23 | Puriel | Serene and insightful, her glowing gaze speaks of boundless patience and understanding. |
| 24 | Rhamiel | Introspective figure glowing with a serene aura, reflecting a divine connection. |
| 25 | Jeremiel | Stoic with eyes gleaming with celestial energy, represents rectitude and resilience. |
| ... | ... | ... |
| 100 | Raguel | Silent observer, shine in his eyes and a commanding aura indicate enormous celestial power. |

## Bugbear
|Dice Value|Name|Description|
|---|---|---|
|1|Hackagle|This bugbear is covered in rough, unkempt fur and has an enormous battle-axe slung over his shoulder.|
|2|Crumgnar|Standing tall, this bugbear is covered in armor crafted from bones and carries a staff adorned with a raven's skull.|
|3|Brotusk|An elder Bugbear with a long, white mane. His scars are testament to many battles fought.|
|4|Snarle Fangbite|This bugbear has sharp extended canines, and his hands have deep bite marks.|
|5|Krumog|This burly bugbear has a stern look on face and a rawhide whip at his belt.|
|6|Grothak|A seemingly blind bugbear, whoâ€™s actuality proficient in hearing and smell, carries a large quarterstaff.|
|7|Jorn Rumbledrum|This bugbear carries a rusted old war drum, enchanting his tribe with rhythmic war songs.|
|8|Rugak|A beastmaster bugbear with multiple pet worgs, has a heavily scarred face.|
|9|Grug Blacktoe|This bugbear has charred toes, result of stepping into a magical fire trap, carries an immolating spear.|
|10|Gorg Knotwhisker|This bugbear has knotted and tangled whiskers, teases enemies with swinging spiked chain.|
|11|Nargab|A shadowy bugbear rogue, proficient with darts from the shadows.|
|12|Thughrum|A bugbear who is a cult fanatic, raises undead skeletons to support his tribe.|
|13|Racknarr|A heavily tattooed bugbear with a grudge against humanoid creatures.|
|14|Rotgrum Woundlicker|This bugbear has unhealthy habit of licking his wounds, carries an acid-etched blade.|
|15|Grulmok|A weathered bugbear ranger who commands respect from his pack.|
|16|Shrak Gutspiller|This bugbear delights in disemboweling his victims and carries a cursed dagger.|
|17|Maglub|Maglub is agile for a bugbear with sinister looking longbow.|
|18|Burgor|This mighty bugbear stands a head taller than his kin and swings a massive flail.|
|19|Krog|A bugbear with sparkling Saphire eyes has mastered the art of illusion magic.|
|20|Gark|A grizzled veteran bugbear, carries a shield made from giant scorpion carapace.|
|...|...|...|
|100|Zog|Zog is a bugbear chief standing taller than his kin, armed with a spiked, oversized, greatclub.|

## Changeling
| Dice Value | Name | Description |
|:---:|:---:|:---:|
| 1 | Vilthris | Sharp features, grey eyes that never seem to focus, and dark hair kept in a tight bun. Prefers dark, loose clothing.
| 2 | Shiral | Clean-cut, with steel grey eyes and blonde hair neatly pulled back. They prefer clothing with cleverly designed hidden pockets.
| 3 | Venn | Ornate silver hair accessories in meticulously arranged hair, piercing violet eyes, always seen in meticulous attire. 
| 4 | Misun | Plain look with deep-set dark eyes and dark hair. Prefers practical, unadorned clothing.
| 5 | Dechire | Pale skin, silver eyes, always seen with a strange, old artifact. 
| 6 | Menon | Bald, with prominent tattoo markings and hawk-like eyes. They dress in tunics of rich colors.
| 7 | Altran | Long dark hair, worrisome look, green changing to blue eyes. Prefers functional clothing.
| 8 | Selith | Sharp eyes of ever-changing color, alabaster skin with an aura of elegance. Prefers luxurious clothing and jewelry.
| 9 | Niiven | Understated appearance; sharp, scrutinizing eyes that can be disconcerting. Casual attire. 
| 10 | Ricter | Broad and tall, dark hair, with a long scar across their face. Often dons sturdy, armored outfits. 
| 11 | Gornost | Weathered skin, hollow cheeks, rigid posture, and eyes that have seen too much. Wears simple, worn-out clothing.
| 12 | Calor | A well-muscled body, hair as black as night, and grey eyes. Adorned in fitting leather attire.
| 13 | Baelis | Slender yet strong build, short-cropped hair, and untrusting cold eyes. Always in practical, combat-ready attire.
| 14 | Ferrin | Broad-built, long dark hair, brown eyes, that show a spark of kindness. Prefers reinforced comfortable attire.
| 15 | Tanish | Lean and tall, with bright eyes that frequently change color. Prefers flowing, decorative clothing.
| 16 | Nimir | Mousy hair, timid posture, and nervous eyes. Often seen in oversized, worn-out clothing.
| 17 | Eldir | Short hair, eyes that seem to look right through you, always dressed in formal attire.
| 18 | Lacen | Strong jawline, short hair, and determined eyes. Typically seen in ornate, heavily embroidered clothing.
| 19 | Malenduis | Crafty, moss green eyes under tousled hair. Prefers bohemian style clothing.
| 20 | Henno | Short and stout, features outlined with sharp tattoos. Usually seen in traditional, tribal-like clothing.
| 21 - 100 |*Roll again thrice, merge different features from results.*| - |

## Dragon
| Dice Value | Name | Description |
|------------|------|-------------|
| 1-2 | Morghul | An ancient and powerful red dragon, known for his fiery temper and destructive rampages. |
| 3-4 | Sylphire | A cunning and deceitful green dragon, often deceives adventurers into her deadly traps. |
| 5-6 | Obsidan | A black dragon who dwells in swampy areas, feared for his corrosive breath and methodical hunting tactics. |
| 7-8 | Voxis | A master manipulator, a blue dragon with enigmatic charm and chilling electrocuting breath. |
| 9-10 | Ethereal | A majestic silver dragon, known for her benevolent nature and unearthly shimmering scales. |
| 11-12 | Ghaldracon | A stern and merciless iron dragon, commands an army of mountainous dwarves at his beck. |
| 13-14 | Solitary | A golden dragon of wisdom, prefers solitude and engages in meditative states of understanding. |
| 15-16 | Nocturnis | A shadow dragon cloaked in darkness, his presence is marked by an eerie sense of cold nothingness. |
| 17-18 | Elyslandra | An exotic and noble brass dragon, shares riddles and wisdom to the chosen few. |
| 19-20 | Thundrax | A bronze dragon known for his electrifying temperament and fierce loyalty to his claimed land. |
| 21-22 | Xenochrest | An elusive crystal dragon, renowned for its mysterious and esoteric knowledge of unseen realms. |
| 23-24 | Frostbane | A dangerous white dragon, feared for his chilling breath and total dominance over icy terrains. |
| 25-26 | Vortexus | A storm dragon who controls formidable weather power, often seen preceding disastrous events. |
| 27-28 | Glacienne | An ice dragon known for her frosty demeanor and influential control over creatures of cold habitats. |
| 29-30 | Ashenflame | A volatile pyroclastic dragon, notoriously known for creating immense destruction with his explosive fits. |
| 31-32 | Seraphina | A radiant and peaceful moonstone dragon, engulfs those in need with healing light from her scales. |
| 33-34 | Kronos | An unstoppable force, an adamantite dragon of supreme strength commanding time and space. |
| 35-36 | Whirlwing | A temperamental copper dragon, perplexes its foes with its whimsical gusts of wind. |
| 37-38 | Dreadfang | A fearsome necrotic dragon, emanates a field of despair and dread inducing necrosis in living beings. |
| 39-40 | Glimmerveil | An ethereal astral dragon, intertwines with cosmic entities, displaying illusions of celestial phenomena. |
| 41-42 | Radix | An earth dragon known for its imperturbable nature and an unwavering bond with the terrestrial energy. |
| 43-44 | Tempest | A driven wind dragon, commands turbulent aerial currents aiming for ultimate control of the skies. |
| 45-46 | Netherqueen | A dreaded void dragon, consumes all magic within her vicinity, leaving behind a emptiness. |
| 47-48 | Veinbeard | A rustic cobalt dragon, dwells underground nurturing a special bond with gem-bearing creatures. |
| 49-50 | Solstice | A revered sun dragon, embodies the warmth and life-enhancing power of the sun. |
| 51-52 | Typhoonis | A fierce sea dragon, holds sovereign rule over the creatures and storms of the ocean. |
| 53-54 | Crux | An imposing granite dragon, embodies the raw power and stability of stone. |
| 55-56 | Blightclaw | The foul and toxically potent plague dragon, his signature decay-inducing toxicity taints land and life alike. |
| 57-58 | Trance | A mystical dream dragon, influences the dreams and nightmares of sleeping creatures. |
| 59-60 | Deeprend | An abyssal dragon, known for his haunting presence deep in the oceanic trenches. |
| 61-100 | [Name] | A veritable [Color/Dragon Breed] dragon, with characteristics in line with their species' nature. |

## Dragonborn
| Dice Value | Name | Description |
|------------|------|-------------|
|1| Korinn | A Dragonborn of white scales with piercing blue eyes. They're a known historian specializing in ancient ruins. |
|2| Thava | Thava is a black-scaled Dragonborn with studded armor and an unwavering devotion to the cause of justice. |
|3| Ehkahk | A skilled blacksmith of green dragon heritage known for crafting weapons of extraordinary quality. |
|4| Ghesh | An enigmatic Dragonborn of blue scales, cleric and a gifted healer. |
|5| Ezirr | A Dragonborn ranger of red dragon ancestry with sun-weathered scales and a stoic demeanor. |
|6| Rasqa | A rogue Dragonborn who trades in secrets, has silver scales that contrast sharply with their dark cloak. |
|7| Qhari | A gold-scaled dragonborn wizard obsessed with recovering lost arcane knowledge. |
|8| Balasar | A bronze Dragonborn paladin, of unwavering loyalty and shining armor. |
|9| Zariel | A copper Dragonborn, renowned bard known for their epic poems and songs across the land. |
|10| Kava | A white Dragonborn, a trader known for their uncanny ability to sense profitable deals. |
|11| Kreytzen | A seasoned Dragonborn warrior of black scales, known for his strength and strategic prowess on the battlefield. |
|12| Mindartis | A silver Dragonborn monk, respected for their discipline and pursuit of enlightenment. |
|13| Jhank | A Dragonborn of green scales, agile and swift, known as an expert scout. |
|14| Ysyria | A Mage of blue scales who spends most of her time in secluded study. |
|15| Torinn | A stoic Dragonborn of red scales, who guards a small village with steadfast commitment. |
|16| HexFang | A silver Dragonborn rogue with a smoky past and a razor-sharp wit. |
|17| Baalrith | A gold Dragonborn sorcerer, known for his eccentricity and uncontrolled bursts of magic. |
|18| Quarethon | A bronze Dragonborn paladin, protector of a sacred shrine who never wavers in his duty. |
|19| Ssylarin | A copper Dragonborn with a golden voice; a traveling troubadour with a penchant for storytelling. |
|20| Irnyrith | A white Dragonborn artificer who creates complex inventions out of the most basic materials. |
|...| ... | ... |
|100| Rhothomir | An ancient Dragonborn of gold scales, an oracle, his eyes radiating mystical energy. |

## Drow
| Dice Value | Name | Description |
| ----------- | ----------- | ----------- |
| 1 | Veerith Har'oloth | An older drow with an aura of self-importance. Dresses in ornate robes. |
| 2 | Ysolde Auvryath | A battle-scarred veteran, tough and taciturn. |
| 3 | Arnos Kenafin | A drow scholar with prismatic spectacles perched on his nose. |
| 4 | Sidara Vlo'Urden | An untrustworthy figure, cloaked in shadows and secrecy. |
| 5 | Serico Melrae'Vasa | A boisterous bard with a dark sense of humor. |
| 6 | Mordrith T'orgh | A quiet figure, constantly scrutinizing their surroundings. |
| 7 | Narath Teken'ghym | A drow druid with a strangely serene demeanor. |
| 8 | Kaelthys Faen Tlabbar | An ambitious drow sorcerer with a powerful aura. |
| 9 | Leosil Mizzr'yin | A twitchy individual with a nervous tic and nervous attitude. |
| 10 | Relna Tlabbar  | A charismatic rogue, smooth talking and shifty. |
| 11 | Veldrin Zeq'nor | An athletic ranger, suspicious of outsiders. |
| 12 | Rizzen N'a'svv | A wise elder drow, with long, white hair and aged features. |
| 13 | Khellendros Mourn | An intimidating drow warrior, covered in old, faded scars. |
| 14 | Zedarr T'sarran | A sly and cunning individual with a beguiling smile. |
| 15 | Yvonnel Bet'ruel | A young and naive drow, still learning their place in the world. |
| 16 | Lualyrr Xiltyn | A quiet and thoughtful individual, with a love for books. |
| 17 | Faenrae Le'fein | A charismatic individual, always at the center of attention. |
| 18 | Tagaun Duskryn | A stoic and gruff individual, seemingly unaffected by hardships. |
| 19 | Khaless Godeep | A quiet drow with a mysterious past. |
| 20 | Zael'Zebrael | A noble drow, looking down their nose at those they consider beneath them. |
| 21-100 | *Roll again or choose one of the above* | *Same as corresponding name* |

## Duergar
| Dice Value | Name | Description |
|---|---|---|
| 1 | Agark | A stout duergar with piercing red eyes and a long braided beard. Proficient miner. |
| 2 | Bhaal | Grizzled veteran, scarred and terse. Reveres discipline above all else. |
| 3 | Caldur | Proud blacksmith, embellishes his armor with intricate designs and runes. |
| 4 | Drak | Cold and calculating traitor. Known to betray his own for the right price. |
| 5 | Eberk | Hardened tavern keeper. Bearded, heavyset, and extraordinarily tough. |
| 6 | Fargrim | Cynical merchant, trades exquisite dark iron artifacts. |
| 7 | Gimal | Reclusive duergar druid. Known to tame the deadliest underdark creatures. |
| 8 | Hael | Master trap maker. Untrusting and highly meticulous. |
| 9 | Ilde | Chieftain's daughter. Smart and beautiful. Struggles against her controlled destiny. |
| 10 | Jardur | Ambitious leader. Ruthless in his quest for power and control. |
| 11 | Kegar | Expert poison maker. Minces few words, communicates primarily through trade. |
| 12 | Largor | Burly, ink-covered duergar. Renowned as a wise and ancient sage. |
| 13 | Mord | Vinemaker. Crafts potent brews, both soothing or deadly. |
| 14 | Narg | Outcast. Renegade duergar on the run for crimes against his people. |
| 15 | Odhran | Uncanny pickpocket. Lives in the shadows, steals unguarded treasures. |
| 16 | Pyrrus | Fire-scorched alchemist. Crafts explosive concoctions with volatile temperament to match. |
| 17 | Queldur | Weapon master at the forge. Designs deadly and exotic weapons. |
| 18 | Rurik | Ex-slave. Understands the underdark from a life of hardship. |
| 19 | Syndur | Mysterious assassin. Cold-hearted and singularly focused on his targets. |
| 20 | Turgon | Expert gemcutter. Crafts intricate designs, gaining the respect of his people. |
| 21-100 | Varun | A silent and secretive duergar scout known for being ruthless and efficient. |

## Dwarves
| Dice Value | Name | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| 1 | Borin Granitebeard | Elderly dwarf, white haired, a respected blacksmith. |
| 2 | Faldar Forgehammer | Young dwarf, ambitious, aspiring armorer. |
| 3 | Thargun Axebearer | Middle-aged soldier, decorated veteran, honorable. |
| 4 | Gormur Ironvein | Stern dwarf sage, knowledgeable in ancient dwarven lore. |
| 5 | Dugmarr Flintfoot | Dwarf merchant, specializes in rare gems and minerals. |
| 6 | Hulgar Steelbraid | Dwarf scout, rough-looking, stealthy, skilled tracker. |
| 7 | Dhargun Earthmantle | Dwarf cleric, deeply religious, serves the god of the forge. |
| 8 | Brundar Brassbeard | Dwarf bard, loud, loves to tell epic tales. |
| 9 | Tholgrin Stoneshield | Dwarf guard, dedicated, takes his job very seriously. |
| 10 | Norur Goldhand | Wealthy dwarf, mine owner, influential in local politics. |
| 11 | Ulfgar Ironeye | Dwarf pirate, gruff, known for metal eyepatch. |
| 12 | Tharain Hardrock | Dwarf geologist, has uncanny ability to find valuable minerals. |
| 13 | Baldin Copperhand | Dwarf coppersmith, dedicated to perfecting his craft. |
| 14 | Thorgrim Gravelgut | Dwarf cook, famous for rock stew. |
| 15 | Nurain Pebbleback | Dwarven healer, uses rare minerals to aid in his treatment. |

| 12| Vorg      | A wise orc shaman who can invoke the spirits of the ancestors. |
| 13| Strakk    | A wily orc scout with a knack for stealth and ambush tactics. |
| 14| Narg      | A crude orc blacksmith known for crafting vicious weapons. |
| 15| Thruk     | A towering orc hunter who relishes the thrill of the chase. |
| 16| Zark      | A low-ranking orc grunt, eager to climb the ranks of his tribe. |
| 17| Grumbul   | An aging orc chieftain struggling to maintain control over his tribe. |
| 18| Kragg     | A brutal orc raider known for his cruel efficiency. |
| 19| Brug      | A slow-witted but strong orc often used as muscle by his smarter kin. |
| 20| Lashnak   | A cunning orc thief with a reputation for disappearing into shadows. |

... (The table continues up to Dice Value 100).

## Tieflings
| Dice Value | Name  | Description |
|--------------|---------|---------------------------------------------------------------------|
| 1-2 | Zephyr | This Tiefling is the quiet type and is rarely seen without a book in their hands. Their eyes shimmer with an almost blue fire. |
| 3-4 | Asmodea | A tall and striking female Tiefling, Asmodea has sparkling purple eyes and an aura of self-assured confidence. |
| 5-6 | Caim | Caim has a devilish charm about him, and his crimson eyes pull you in closer. He carries a longsword on his back and a lute by his waist.  |
| 7-8 | Astaroth | A rugged and somber Tiefling, Astaroth has seen hard times yet continues to push on with resilience and determination. |
| 9-10 | Baal | This Tiefling has a deep and echoing voice and has an almost regal air about him, reflected in his immaculately kept silver horns. |
| 11-12 | Lilith | Lilith is a stunning female Tiefling with glowing emerald eyes and a captivating aura. She's quick with her wit, often leaving others off balance. |
| 13-14 | Morax | His dark hood barely conceals the glowing red eyes of Morax. He's an individual of few words and many secrets. |
| 15-16 | Vine | Vine has an air of danger about her. There's an unpredictable light in her eyes that makes others tread carefully. |
| 17-18 | Abaddon | An older Tiefling, Abaddon is wise and carries decades of carefully balanced experience behind their dark eyes. |
| 19-20 | Legion | This Tiefling is endearingly clumsy, often tripping over their tail, but their bright smile and exuberance are infectious. |
| 21-22 | Belphegor | Belphegor has a calm demeanor, often found meditating. His sinuous tail constantly moves to a rhythm only he seems to hear. |
| 23-24 | Aamon | Small for a Tiefling, Aamon commands respect with his fiery eyes and stern demeanor. |
| 25-26 | Armaros | A Tiefling of few words. His hand always gripping the hilt of his blade, ready to draw at a moment's notice. |
| 27-28 | Zepar | Zepar has a quick laugh and a quicker temper. His wild hair matches his unchecked fiery passion. |
| 29-30 | Beleth | A humble Tiefling healer, Beleth is basically seen without his herb pouch and a smile. |
| 31-32 | Decarabia | Decarabia has a deep love for animals and can often be found surrounded by them. |
| 33-34 | Focalor | Focalor has an odd fascination with the weather and spends most of their time studying the skies. |
| 35-36 | Glasya-Labolas | When it comes to knowledge of magic, few can match this Tiefling. Their eyes shine with insatiable curiosity. |
| 37-38 | Shax | Shax has a strong distrust of strangers but is fiercely loyal to those she calls friends. |
| 39-40 | Stolas | His silver hair well-kept and his eyes sharp as a hawk's, Stolas is a man of refined tastes. |
| 41-42 | Xaphan | Xaphan is a mirthful individual often seen playing a stringed instrument at local taverns, enchanting listeners with her melodies. |
| 43-44 | Amy | This Tiefling's eyes conceal centuries of wisdom. Their quiet demeanor and frail form contradict their incredible magical abilities. |
| 45-46 | Buer | Buer's gaze is intense, yet quiet and careful. They are a skilled herbalist and seldom leave their apothecary. |
| 47-48 | Malphas | Malphas is a nimble fingered thief, and their roguish charm is infamous in the city's underworld. |
| 49-50 | Raum | Raum is a mysterious Tiefling, draped in cloaks and shadows. He's an informant and an enigma, trading in secrets and whispers. |
| 51-52 | Vassago | Possessed of a silver tongue, Vassago can confidently navigate the treacherous world of politics and intrigue. |
| 53-54 | Orias | Orias is a seasoned sailor with a love for the sea. His skills in navigation are sought after by many. |
| 55-56 | Naberius | Naberius has mastered the art of deception and uses his charm to manipulate others into doing his bidding. |
| 57-58 | Haagenti | Haagenti is a renowned blacksmith whose weapons are considered works of art. |
| 59-60 | Barbatos | This Tiefling is a capable knight with a strong sense of justice. |
| 61-62 | Mammon | Connoisseur of fine things, Mammon is a merchant of exotic goods with an eye for quality. |
| 63-64 | Marax | Strong and quiet, Marax is a farmer with a sharp intellect and a heart of gold. |
| 65-66 | Paimon | Paimon is an advisor known for her clever stratagems and a no-nonsense attitude. |
| 67-68 | Sabnock | A hardy wilderness guide, Sabnock knows every inch of the local wilderness. |
| 69-70 | Valefar | Valefar is a cunning controller of dreams and nightmares, possessing a mind unlike any other. |
| 71-72 | Eligos | Skilled in negotiation and diplomacy, Eligos is known to resolve disputes with ease. |
| 73-74 | Leraje | Dark and brooding, Leraje is a master archer, her shot never misses. |
| 75-76 | Alastor | A grizzled veteran soldier who commands respect from all who meet him. |
| 77-78 | Alloces | Alloces stands tall, her blue-edged horns and azure eyes leave a lasting impression. |
| 79-80 | Gaap | Unpredictable and wild, Gaap is a whirlwind of energy who can't resist a good party. |
| 81-82 | Aim | With a quiet strength, Aim is a resourceful hunter, always on the prowl. |
| 83-84 | Orobas | Orobas is an empath who always seems to understand emotions deeper than anyone else. |
| 85-86 | Zagan | Zagan is a talented artisan known throughout the kingdom for her intricate jewelry designs. |
| 87-88 | Purson | Known for his culinary skills, Purson is a restaurant owner with a flame-colored tail. |
| 89-90 | Ipos | Revered by many, feared by some, Ipos is a powerful sorcerer known for his lightning-fast incantations. |
| 91-92 | Amdusias | Amdusias has a voice that soothes the soul. His songs are a thing of beauty, and his melodies, legendary. |
| 93-94 | Andras | Andras is a skilled fencer, always looking for a challenging duel. |
| 95-96 | Foras | Foras has a knack for fixing things, be it a broken wagon wheel or a faulty lock. He's the go-to handyman in the community. |
| 97-98 | Gremory | Gremory wears a constant smirk on their face. They are a clever trickster and always seem to have a prank up their sleeve. |
| 99-100 | Murmur | Murmur, a soft-spoken scholar, has a mind full of endless lore and tales of times long past. |
